page.title: 07ST EDMUND'S CHURCH
page.content: St Edmunds Church is unusual because it faces south although most churches face east so that they are pointing to the Holy Land. The most holy part of the church is the sanctuary because that is where the Communion is held. The Goddard Room was built most recently and it commemorates Mr Goddard who worked hard to have the church built. The main part of the church is called the nave because it comes from the word navy as it looks like an upturned boat. The church is also used as a community centre for meetings and playgroups.
